paragraphs.body: The Capital City Prison, also known as Prison Tower, is a large, fortified stone tower located in the ${link_0} inside the hollow volcanic crater that also contains the ${link_1}, where highly prioritized criminals are kept.
paragraphs.text: The Capital City Prison, also known as Prison Tower, is a large, fortified stone tower located in the Fire Nation inside the hollow volcanic crater that also contains the capital city, where highly prioritized criminals are kept.

paragraphs.body: After their defeat against ${link_0} and ${link_1}, some of the ${link_2} were imprisoned here.
paragraphs.text: After their defeat against Azula and her friends, some of the Kyoshi Warriors were imprisoned here.

paragraphs.body: After his capture at ${link_0}, ${link_1} was imprisoned here. Prior to the ${link_2}, he secretly began a rigorous workout, able to regain a significant amount of strength. Using the eclipse and Warden ${link_3}'s lack of firebending to his advantage, Iroh easily overwhelmed him and escaped. After ${link_4} declared his intentions of joining the ${link_5}, he went to free Iroh from prison, only to find a busted up cage and a semi-conscious Warden Poon.
paragraphs.text: After his capture at Ba Sing Se, Iroh was imprisoned here. Prior to the eclipse, he secretly began a rigorous workout, able to regain a significant amount of strength. Using the eclipse and Warden Poon's lack of firebending to his advantage, Iroh easily overwhelmed him and escaped. After Zuko declared his intentions of joining the Avatar, he went to free Iroh from prison, only to find a busted up cage and a semi-conscious Warden Poon.

paragraphs.body: After the failed ${link_0} on the Day of Black Sun, the prison was used to house many of the captured invaders and war prisoners, such as ${link_1}, until their transfer to the ${link_2}. After ${link_3} ${link_4} was defeated by Avatar ${link_5}, he was incarcerated here.
paragraphs.text: After the failed invasion on the Day of Black Sun, the prison was used to house many of the captured invaders and war prisoners, such as Hakoda, until their transfer to the Boiling Rock. After Fire Lord Ozai was defeated by Avatar Aang, he was incarcerated here.

paragraphs.body: Most of the ${link_0} was imprisoned here after participating in a riot in the capital city. Their leader, ${link_1}, later joined them after turning himself in.
paragraphs.text: Most of the Safe Nation Society was imprisoned here after participating in a riot in the capital city. Their leader, Ukano, later joined them after turning himself in.

paragraphs.body: The interior consists of various caged cells made of stone, which are watched over by guards like ${link_0}. This design allows guards to enter without being attacked. It should also be noted that even though the prisoner is locked in the cage, the actual cell door is generally left unlocked.
paragraphs.text: The interior consists of various caged cells made of stone, which are watched over by guards like Ming. This design allows guards to enter without being attacked. It should also be noted that even though the prisoner is locked in the cage, the actual cell door is generally left unlocked.
